title: Zion National Park: Rodents
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Mammals     Rodents                  Remarkable Rodents       Zion National Park provides habitat for a variety of rodents (34 species total), including pocket gophers, rock squirrels, chipmunks, porcupines, and over a dozen types of mice and rats. Click on the links below to learn more about these common species:            American Beaver            Chipmunks            Pocket Gophers           Porcupine             Rock Squirrel        Return to Mammals or to the main Wildlife page
